description: OSHA regulations and workplace safety standards

danger_signatures.pattern: no (harness|fall protection|safety line|guardrail)|working at height without|ladder without
danger_signatures.message: OSHA requires fall protection at heights of 6+ feet in construction, 4+ feet in general industry
OSHA requires appropriate PPE for hazardous work conditions
Confined spaces require air testing, ventilation, and rescue plans per OSHA
OSHA requires lockout/tagout procedures before servicing equipment
OSHA prohibits work on energized electrical systems without proper safeguards
Scaffolds must be properly constructed with guardrails and stable base
Trenches 5+ feet deep require protective systems against cave-ins
Forklift operators must be trained and certified; improper use causes deaths
Hazardous chemicals require SDS sheets, proper labeling, and ventilation
Hearing protection required when noise exceeds 85 decibels (8-hour TWA)

danger_signatures.pattern: dust without (mask|respirator)|fumes without|spray paint without|asbestos|silica dust
danger_signatures.message: Respiratory protection required for airborne hazards
Machine guards must never be removed; they prevent amputations and deaths
Welding requires proper PPE, ventilation, and fire prevention measures
Never stand under suspended loads; use proper rigging techniques
Ladders must be at proper angle (4:1), never use top step, maintain 3 points of contact

safe_practices: Always conduct Job Safety Analysis (JSA) before work
Use proper PPE for each task
Maintain 3 points of contact on ladders
Test air quality in confined spaces
Keep work areas clean and organized
